title: Fleischner Society Guidelines for Incidental Pulmonary Nodules
description: Provides guidelines for management of solid and subsolid pulmonary nodules detected incidentally on CT

parameters.name: risk_level
parameters.description: Patient risk level based on clinical factors

parameters.name: subsolid_features
parameters.description: Features of subsolid nodule (required if nodule_type is subsolid)

result.name: recommendation
result.description: Follow-up recommendation based on Fleischner Society Guidelines

references: MacMahon H, Naidich DP, Goo JM, Lee KS, Leung ANC, Mayo JR, et al. Guidelines for Management of Incidental Pulmonary Nodules Detected on CT Images: From the Fleischner Society 2017. Radiology. 2017 Jul;284(1):228-243. doi: 10.1148/radiol.2017161659.

Bankier AA, MacMahon H, Goo JM, Rubin GD, Schaefer-Prokop CM, Naidich DP. Recommendations for Measuring Pulmonary Nodules at CT: A Statement from the Fleischner Society. Radiology. 2017 Nov;285(2):584-600. doi: 10.1148/radiol.2017162894.
formula: Recommendation based on nodule type (solid/subsolid), number (single/multiple), size (<6mm, 6-8mm, >8mm), and risk level (low/high)
notes: Guidelines apply to patients ≥35 years old with incidental pulmonary nodules
Not applicable for lung cancer screening
Not for patients with known primary cancer or immunosuppression
Low risk: Minimal or no smoking history, no other risk factors
High risk: Heavy smoking history, family history, upper lobe location, spiculation, older age
Nodule size should be measured as average of long and short axis for nodules <10mm
Consider thin-section CT (≤1.5mm) with multiplanar reconstructions
